item.title: What's new in Visual Studio Code
item.description:
In this video, we showcase the new features of Visual Studio Code, including multi-root workspaces, multiple source control systems, automatic TypeScript imports, extract method refactorings, region folding, and much more.


Product info: code.visualstudio.com
Documentation: code.visualstudio.com/docs

item.title: Put your databases on autopilot with Azure SQL Database
item.description:
Azure SQL Database is the perfect choice to deliver the right mix of operational efficiencies, optimized for performance and cost, so you can focus on business enablement to accelerate growth and innovation. In this session, you’ll learn more about the benefits of the fully managed SQL Database, and how to select the right deployment options for your workload.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/sql-database/
Learn more: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/sql-database/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-database/sql-database-troubleshoot-performance

item.title: Build SQL Server 2017 applications on Linux
item.description:
Interested in developing Python, Java, C#, Ruby, GO, or PHP apps with SQL Server on Linux, but don’t know where to start? In this video, you will learn how to get started and make apps with these languages by using SQL Server installed on Linux. You'll also view the results by using our latest cross-platform tool, SQL Operations Studio, which can help you manage SQL Server databases from Windows, Linux, or Mac.


Product info: www.microsoft.com/sqlserver2017
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/sql-server/

item.title: C++ development in Visual Studio Code
item.description:

This talk offers an overview of Visual Studio Code and the Visual Studio Code C++ extension. Learn how to use Visual Studio Code to edit, build, and debug your C++ code across Windows, Mac, and Linux.


Product info: code.visualstudio.com/

item.description: Azure Database for PostgreSQL and Azure Database for MySQL bring together community edition database engines and capabilities of a fully managed service—so you can focus on your apps instead of having to manage a database. Tune in to get a quick overview of the advantages of using the service, and see some of the capabilities in action.

item.description:
Visual Studio Team Services is not a cloud-only solution. You can use Visual Studio Team Services to build in the cloud and deploy on-premises with deployment groups. If more control is required, host your on-premises build agents and build on-premises. Join us and see the possibilities!

Join us as we build a Python Flask application and deploy it to Azure App Service by using Visual Studio Team Services.

item.description: In this presentation, you’ll see how to easily connect Azure Databricks with SQL Data Warehouse to run high-performance data pipelines for access to powerful analytics models. Incorporate machine learning algorithms and put the results back into SQL Data Warehouse to drive PowerBI dashboards.

item.title: Azure Databricks Runtime: Dialing up Spark performance 10x
item.description:
Spark is known for its high-performance analytical engine. Azure Databricks Runtime, a component of Azure Databricks, incorporates tuning and optimizations refined by the creators of Spark to run Spark processes, in many cases, ten times faster. Learn how Azure Databricks Runtime can save your organization money by performing analytics faster.


Product info: azure.com/databricks/
Learn more: docs.azuredatabricks.net/
Documentation: docs.azuredatabricks.net/user-guide/faq/index.html

item.title: Get enterprise security for big data apps with Azure Databricks
item.description:
In this presentation, you’ll see how Azure Databricks provides features like Active Directory integration to help your users to get productive instantly, while helping to ensure the security of your big data applications. By taking advantage of fine-grained controls and other essential features, you can manage access and capabilities across your enterprise.


Product info: azure.com/databricks/

item.description:
With Azure HDInsight, you can build a scalable, high-performing, reliable IoT pipeline. In this presentation, you’ll learn about the Hyperscale pipeline we’ve designed. The pipeline can handle petabytes of streaming data per day for Near Real Time (NRT) predictive analytics.

item.title: Embed Time Series Analytics in custom apps with Time Series Insights
item.description:
Azure Time Series Insights is a one-of-a-kind platform. It not only provides scalable storage for time series data and a visual analytics experience, but also exposes powerful REST Query APIs. Many organizations, such as Steelcase, use these APIs to build custom solutions. In this session, you’ll learn how to leverage REST Query APIs to build your own custom applications.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/time-series-insights/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/time-series-insights/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/time-series-insights/time-series-insights-reference-queryapi

item.title: Core concepts of U-SQL batch query execution in Data Lake Analytics
item.description:
To become proficient in authoring, debugging, and optimizing U-SQL code in Azure Data Lake Analytics, a developer must master the key concepts that underlie query execution. By using demos, this session dives deep into the underlying layers of the Data Lake Analytics service to explore fundamental query execution and performance concepts.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/solutions/data-lake/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-lake-analytics/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-lake-analytics/data-lake-analytics-u-sql-get-started

item.title: Real-time analytics on IoT Edge with Azure Stream Analytics
item.description:
Azure Stream Analytics is a PaaS solution in Azure that helps uncover insights from data that’s generated by devices, sensors, cloud infrastructure services, and applications in real time. This session demonstrates the power of built-in, inline anomaly-detection capabilities in Stream Analytics—which helps abstract the complexity of machine learning algorithms and associated data science from the developers.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/stream-analytics/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/stream-analytics/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/stream-analytics/stream-analytics-machine-learning-anomaly-detection

item.title: Large-scale data processing in Azure Data Lake
item.description:
Data scientists and data wranglers often have existing code that they want to use at scale over large data sets. In this presentation, we show how you can take your existing Python, R, and Java code and libraries—and formats like Parquet—and apply them at scale to schematize unstructured data and process large amounts of data in Azure Data Lake with U-SQL.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/solutions/data-lake/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-lake-analytics/
Documentation: msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/mt591959

item.title: SQL Server 2017: Built for performance
item.description:
In this video, you'll learn how SQL Server 2017 includes a database engine that's fast, scalable, and built for performance—without needing a lot of configuration. This latest version includes new features to automatically tune database queries, so you can focus on application and data logic. And it’s built for speed, ensuring that you’re investing in a platform that scales to the largest enterprise workloads.


Product info: www.microsoft.com/sqlserver2017
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/sql-server/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/performance/performance-center-for-sql-server-database-engine-and-azure-sql-database

item.title: Lift and shift SSIS to the cloud by using Azure Data Factory
item.description:
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) customers can easily lift and shift their SSIS packages to the cloud by using the new managed SSIS hosting capabilities in Azure Data Factory, as announced at Ignite. In this session, you’ll learn how to utilize the Integration Runtimes (IR) feature. By spinning-up an SSIS IR in Azure Data Factory, you will be able to execute, manage, monitor, and deploy SSIS packages in the cloud.


Learn more: - docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/tutorial-deploy-ssis-packages-azure
Documentation: - docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/data-factory/tutorial-deploy-ssis-packages-azure

item.title: Optimize for compute: New Azure SQL Data Warehouse performance tier
item.description:
With the recent launch of the compute-optimized Azure SQL Data Warehouse service, users can now take advantage of hardware innovations such as non-volatile memory express (NVMe) solid state drives (SSDs) to deliver up to 100x performance gains on customer workloads. This session explains the innovation and demonstrates the value that an optimized-for-compute performance tier can bring to your cloud data warehouse.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/sql-data-warehouse/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-data-warehouse/massively-parallel-processing-mpp-architecture
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-data-warehouse/performance-tiers

item.description:
Customers who are modernizing their datacenters increasingly seek to lift and shift their databases to the cloud with less effort and at lower cost. Azure SQL Database Managed Instance is the ideal destination, with enterprise security, full app compatibility, and unique intelligent PaaS capabilities that reduce overall TCO. In this session, learn about Managed Instance and how to apply it to your journey to the cloud.

item.title: Protect customer data with advanced security features in SQL Database
item.description:
Take a first-hand look at the Azure SQL Database intelligent security offering. In this session, you'll get an overview of how to secure your data in Azure SQL Database. The session covers our latest advanced and intelligent security features, including Transparent Database Encryption with Bring Your Own Keys support, Always Encrypted, universal, multi-factor authentication, Vulnerability Assessment and Threat Detection, including important concepts and demos.

item.title: Use SQL Server 2017 in Docker containers for your CI/CD process
item.description:
Interested in automating your database-development process by using containers? This video presents the basics of running SQL Server 2017 in Docker containers, building your own Docker image, and combining an app and a SQL Server database as a service. It also covers the simplest way to enable the application and database environment in a container platform such as Kubernetes in Azure Container Service.


Product info: www.microsoft.com/sqlserver2017

item.description:

Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-database/
Documentation: aka.ms/sql-database-saas

item.title: Get graph support in SQL Server 2017 and Azure SQL Database
item.description:
In this session, you’ll learn how to create a graph in SQL Server 2017 or SQL Database, and how graph relationships differ from foreign key relationships in an RDBMS. You’ll also learn how to insert data into graph tables, how to intuitively query complex graph data by using the new MATCH built-in, and when to use the graph approach in your application.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/sql-database/
Learn more: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/sql-database/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/relational-databases/graphs/sql-graph-overview

You'll also learn about some of the underlying investments in security and worldwide availability.

item.title: Hub-and-spoke data warehouses
item.description:
Siloed data marts can lead to incomplete information and additional headcount cost. A monolithic data warehouse has inherent limits. We’ll discuss the benefits of a hub-and-spoke architecture where SQL Data Warehouse acts as a hub for the data marts. You’ll also learn how you can integrate Azure Functions to fully leverage the elasticity of SQL Data Warehouse with autoscale capabilities.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/sql-data-warehouse/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/sql-data-warehouse/

Use Logpoints to insert new logging statements in your app, on-the-fly. You also get full visibility into your exceptions with automatic snapshots from Application Insights.

The easy onboarding and management experience now available with Azure Functions also applies to Linux-based offers.

item.title: Intelligent enterprise search: Build a powerful document search system
item.description:
Data is being created at an exponential rate and the vast majority of this content sits in unstructured formats such as PDF's, Office documents, Emails and Images. In this session we will discuss some of the challenges unstructured data presents and will show how Microsoft Cognitive Services and Azure Search can help you navigate it, understand it and allow you to extract insight from unstructured text.

item.title: Cloud development with Visual Studio Code and Azure
item.description:
Your editor is your lifeblood—your tether to your code. When you leave code to other tools, you lose the familiarity and efficiency where you thrive. Instead, why not bring the power of the cloud to your editor? In this session, you learn how to take advantage of Azure from Visual Studio Code, by using extensions that make it easy to manage containers, databases, and web apps.

Learn more: aka.ms/node-dev

item.description: Microsoft has a long history with building great Python tooling for Visual Studio. item.description:
In this session, you will learn how Azure Bot Service accelerates the process of developing a bot. Bot Service provisions a web host with one of five bot templates that you can modify in an integrated environment. You will learn how to quickly and easily create a bot in either C# or Node.js by using one of the templates.

item.description:
Stop chasing illusive performance issues in your production web services and save time by using the brand-new APM v2 in Application Insights. Get full-screen interactive triage, deep dive into call trees with the AI profiler, see a holistic view of your dependencies, and take it to the next level with Analytics. Performance engineering doesn't have to be rocket science!

item.title: Introduction to Azure Databricks
item.description: Azure Databricks, a fast, easy and collaborative Apache® Spark™ based analytics platform optimized for Azure. Designed in collaboration with the founders of Apache Spark, Azure Databricks combines the best of Databricks and Azure to help customers accelerate innovation with one-click set up; streamlined workflows and an interactive workspace that enables collaboration between data scientists, data engineers, and business analysts. As an Azure service, customers automatically benefit native integration with other Azure services such as Power BI, SQL Data Warehouse, Cosmos DB as well as from enterprise-grade Azure security, including Active Directory integration, compliance, and enterprise-grade SLAs.

item.title: Build serverless apps with Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions
item.description:
In this session, you learn how to build planet-scale serverless apps in minutes by using Azure Cosmos DB and Azure Functions. Customers expect apps to offer event-driven, near real-time experiences. Now you can subscribe to changes in Azure Cosmos DB collections and trigger logic in real time while delivering globally-distributed apps—without deploying or managing any servers.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cosmos-db/

item.description:
TypeScript continues to push the envelope by providing rock-solid tooling, advanced type system features for modeling the highly dynamic parts of JavaScript, and even greater type safety. It helps you resolve issues from simple typos to much more complex bugs that might be hard to find. Come learn about the new features we’ve delivered between TypeScript 2.4 and TypeScript 2.6.

Documentation: www.typescriptlang.org/docs/home.html

item.title: Enable edge intelligence with Azure IoT Edge
item.description:
Make hybrid cloud and edge IoT solutions a reality with Azure IoT Edge, a capability that enables cloud workloads to run locally on your Windows and Linux-based IoT devices. Develop and test workloads in the cloud, and then deploy them to the edge seamlessly via Docker-compatible containers. Watch Olivier describe the concepts of IoT Edge and demo the basics of an edge device configuration and deployment.

item.title: Get high-performance streaming analytics with Azure Databricks
item.description:
Customers turn to Azure Databricks for their highest-performance streaming analytics projects. In this session, see IoT examples of how to build a structured streaming pipeline by using HDI Kafka in Azure Databricks notebooks. Perform debugging and put your notebook into production quickly for access by your organization to drive critical, analytics-based decisions.


Product info: azure.com/databricks/

item.description:

item.title: What's new in C#
item.description:
Learn about the new features available in C# 7.1 and 7.2, including async Main, default literals, ref extension methods, in parameters and more. Also get a glimpse of the future with nullable reference types.

item.title: Modernize business-critical .NET applications by using containers
item.description:
Learn how containers can help your existing .NET applications improve server utilization and save you dev time. In this session, we introduce—through real-world customer examples—the use of containers to deploy and operate .NET applications at scale.

item.title: Machine Learning on the cutting edge: Azure ML and IoT Edge
item.description:
Bring intelligence to the edge by creating, training, and operationalizing models as Docker containers by using Azure Machine Learning. The containers can then be deployed to IoT Edge devices. In this session, we provide a scenario about the importance of edge intelligence, and an overview of Azure ML and Azure IoT Edge. Then we demonstrate how to use Azure ML to create a model and run it on an IoT Edge device.


Product info: aka.ms/aml-preview-page
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/preview/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/preview/

item.title: Introduction to Visual Studio App Center
item.description:
In this introduction to Visual Studio App Center, you learn how to get set up and started quickly with the various features that App Center has to offer. With App Center, you can build, test, deploy, and monitor your Android, iOS, Windows, and macOS apps all in one place—with continuous integration, delivery, and monitoring. Automate and manage the lifecycle of your apps, and ship higher-quality apps more frequently.


Product info: www.visualstudio.com/app-center/

item.dc:creator: James White

item.title: Microsoft Cognitive Services: Put intelligence into your business apps
item.description:
Learn how to easily build custom AI applications without a PhD by using only simple cloud APIs. In this session, we explore how you can easily take advantage of the Vision capabilities of Microsoft Cognitive Services to make your apps smarter. As you build your own image classifier, we explain key industry examples and provide interactive demonstrations about how systems can see people and understand emotions.


Product info: azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cognitive-services/directory/vision/
Learn more: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/computer-vision/
Documentation: docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/computer-vision/home

item.dc:creator: Kelly Freed

item.title: Designing Distributed Applications With High Availability at Global Scale
item.description: How Azure Platform and Azure SQL Database can be leveraged to build a scale out data layers for applications availability and ensuring business continuity across a complex application and customer landscape. We will take a deeper look at how to actually design for multi-tenancy and geo-distribution, but also how to implement these solutions using features available to Azure SQL Database.
item.itunes:summary: How Azure Platform and Azure SQL Database can be leveraged to build a scale out data layers for applications availability and ensuring business continuity across a complex application and customer landscape. We will take a deeper look at how to actually design for multi-tenancy and geo-distribution, but also how to implement these solutions using features available to Azure SQL Database.
item.dc:creator: Sasha Nosov, Ayo Olubeko

item.title: Database DevOps for .NET Developers with SSDT and SQL Server 2017
item.description: Learn how to use SQL Server 2017 in CI/CD pipelines by using SQL Server Data Tools in Visual Studio 2017. By the end of this session, you will know how to run SQL Server 2017 in Docker, make schema changes, run database unit tests, and use Visual Studio Team Services to continuously deploy your database changes to Azure.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to use SQL Server 2017 in CI/CD pipelines by using SQL Server Data Tools in Visual Studio 2017. By the end of this session, you will know how to run SQL Server 2017 in Docker, make schema changes, run database unit tests, and use Visual Studio Team Services to continuously deploy your database changes to Azure.
item.dc:creator: Brian A. Randell

item.title: Building planet scale apps with real-time personalization
item.description: In this session, we will take a look at Azure Cosmos DB and learn why users choose Azure Cosmos DB for their planet-scale applications. Then we will dive deeper to cover important design aspects around global distribution, consistency, and server-side partitioning.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, we will take a look at Azure Cosmos DB and learn why users choose Azure Cosmos DB for their planet-scale applications. Then we will dive deeper to cover important design aspects around global distribution, consistency, and server-side partitioning.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liu

item.title: Zero to DevOps with Visual Studio Team Services
item.description: DevOps is the union of people, process, and our products to enable continuous delivery of value to our users. Such continuous delivery is extraordinarily important in our world today, but it’s very difficult to do right. Come see how to implement Zero to DevOps for any language—and target any platform—by using Visual Studio Team Services. It’s the ultimate DevOps solution into Azure.
item.itunes:summary: DevOps is the union of people, process, and our products to enable continuous delivery of value to our users. Such continuous delivery is extraordinarily important in our world today, but it’s very difficult to do right. Come see how to implement Zero to DevOps for any language—and target any platform—by using Visual Studio Team Services. It’s the ultimate DevOps solution into Azure.
item.dc:creator: Abel Wang

item.title: ETL 2.0: Data Engineering using Azure Databricks and Apache Spark
item.description: Applications are starting to make use of analytics to provide personalization and recommendations. In this session, we cover things like an introduction to data science, end-to-end MLlib Pipelines in Apache Spark, and code examples in Scala and Python.
item.itunes:summary: Applications are starting to make use of analytics to provide personalization and recommendations. In this session, we cover things like an introduction to data science, end-to-end MLlib Pipelines in Apache Spark, and code examples in Scala and Python.
item.dc:creator: Richard Garris

item.title: Get started with .NET Standard 2.0
item.description: One of the great things about .NET is that you use it to write code for multiple runtimes, such as .NET Core, .NET Framework, and Xamarin. But multiple runtimes means some complexity in writing, distributing, and consuming libraries. .NET Standard solves this problem. Write code to a specification instead of for specific platforms. .NET Standard 2.0 takes it to the next level, with more than 20K new APIs.
item.itunes:summary: One of the great things about .NET is that you use it to write code for multiple runtimes, such as .NET Core, .NET Framework, and Xamarin. But multiple runtimes means some complexity in writing, distributing, and consuming libraries. .NET Standard solves this problem. Write code to a specification instead of for specific platforms. .NET Standard 2.0 takes it to the next level, with more than 20K new APIs.
item.dc:creator: Ted Neward

item.title: Build a Windows 10 application that runs anywhere using the Universal Windows Platform
item.description: Windows 10 runs on a variety of devices, including desktop, mobile, Xbox, and IoT. Before Windows 10, supporting multiple devices meant creating multiple projects. With UWP, you can create apps that target multiple device types from a single code base. In this session, you’ll learn how to create a new UWP application that runs on multiple device families while still taking advantage of each device's unique features.
item.itunes:summary: Windows 10 runs on a variety of devices, including desktop, mobile, Xbox, and IoT. Before Windows 10, supporting multiple devices meant creating multiple projects. With UWP, you can create apps that target multiple device types from a single code base. In this session, you’ll learn how to create a new UWP application that runs on multiple device families while still taking advantage of each device's unique features.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Stevens, Mark Smith

item.title: Securing your web applications with ASP.NET Core 2.0
item.description: Building secure web apps is challenging, but ASP.NET Core 2.0 makes it easier. In this session, learn some key web security concepts, and then dive into the nuts and bolts of applying these concepts in a modern application. You'll see how the built-in security features of ASP.NET Core 2.0 work together with hardening measures like HTTP security headers and TLS to keep your apps and users safe.
item.itunes:summary: Building secure web apps is challenging, but ASP.NET Core 2.0 makes it easier. In this session, learn some key web security concepts, and then dive into the nuts and bolts of applying these concepts in a modern application. You'll see how the built-in security features of ASP.NET Core 2.0 work together with hardening measures like HTTP security headers and TLS to keep your apps and users safe.
item.dc:creator: Nate Barbettini

item.title: Use UWP to modernize your existing WinForms and WPF applications
item.description: There is no denying that WinForms/WPF development is popular for desktop development. It's time to consider integrating these existing applications with features found in the Universal Windows Platform. This session looks at the Visual Studio 2017 tools that ease the transition to UWP and introduces you to the benefits of .NET Standard 2.0.
item.itunes:summary: There is no denying that WinForms/WPF development is popular for desktop development. It's time to consider integrating these existing applications with features found in the Universal Windows Platform. This session looks at the Visual Studio 2017 tools that ease the transition to UWP and introduces you to the benefits of .NET Standard 2.0.
item.dc:creator: Walt Ritscher

item.title: Connect apps to the cloud using Xamarin and Azure
item.description: Every mobile app should have a great cloud service back end. Microsoft Azure provides a wealth of reliable services that you can easily take advantage of by using C# and .NET. This session shows you how to use some of the great features in Azure, including synchronized data storage and server-side logic processing.
item.itunes:summary: Every mobile app should have a great cloud service back end. Microsoft Azure provides a wealth of reliable services that you can easily take advantage of by using C# and .NET. This session shows you how to use some of the great features in Azure, including synchronized data storage and server-side logic processing.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Stevens, Mark Smith

item.title: Continuous integration and delivery with Visual Studio App Center
item.description: Learn how to quickly get your app connected to a continuous integration and deployment pipeline by using Visual Studio App Center. We'll explore how to automate the entire app lifecycle. Build, test, distribute, and publish your iOS, Android, Windows, and macOS apps faster, and with more confidence.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to quickly get your app connected to a continuous integration and deployment pipeline by using Visual Studio App Center. We'll explore how to automate the entire app lifecycle. Build, test, distribute, and publish your iOS, Android, Windows, and macOS apps faster, and with more confidence.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Stevens, Mark Smith

item.title: Migrate your applications to Azure virtual machines
item.description: For many applications, the easiest path to the cloud is to move them to an Azure virtual machine. Azure Virtual Machines offers a fully customizable cloud environment that can host any type of app. You’ll get the basics of how to “lift and shift” your app from on-premises to an Azure virtual machine. You’ll also learn the steps to take to incrementally prepare the app to run in a Platform as a Service environment.
item.itunes:summary: For many applications, the easiest path to the cloud is to move them to an Azure virtual machine. Azure Virtual Machines offers a fully customizable cloud environment that can host any type of app. You’ll get the basics of how to “lift and shift” your app from on-premises to an Azure virtual machine. You’ll also learn the steps to take to incrementally prepare the app to run in a Platform as a Service environment.
item.dc:creator: Justin Clareburt, Lisa Guthrie

item.title: Build cross-platform apps with Visual Studio, Xamarin and .NET
item.description: Learn how easily you can build apps for iOS, Android, and Windows by using C# and Visual Studio Tools for Xamarin. We'll show you how to share your code with .NET Standard libraries and build both a native UI that creates a unique presentation on each platform and a shared UI with Xamarin.Forms. You'll then see how to run the code right from Visual Studio with Xamarin Live Player, emulators, and your own personal devices.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how easily you can build apps for iOS, Android, and Windows by using C# and Visual Studio Tools for Xamarin. We'll show you how to share your code with .NET Standard libraries and build both a native UI that creates a unique presentation on each platform and a shared UI with Xamarin.Forms. You'll then see how to run the code right from Visual Studio with Xamarin Live Player, emulators, and your own personal devices.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Stevens, Mark Smith

item.title: Azure: “Kubernetes the Easy Way” Managed Kubernetes on Azure AKS
item.description: We'll get hands-on with Azure Managed Kubernetes (AKS) and walk you through how to manage your containers using AKS—from provisioning your first cluster to scaling and managing upgrades for your container-based Cloud apps. We'll also take a look at how you can use Draft and Helm to make your life even easier, containerize your existing applications, and deploy them into an AKS cluster.
item.itunes:summary: We'll get hands-on with Azure Managed Kubernetes (AKS) and walk you through how to manage your containers using AKS—from provisioning your first cluster to scaling and managing upgrades for your container-based Cloud apps. We'll also take a look at how you can use Draft and Helm to make your life even easier, containerize your existing applications, and deploy them into an AKS cluster.
item.dc:creator: Eddie Villalba

item.title: Get started with Bot Framework and Cortana skills
item.description: This session introduces you to Microsoft Bot Framework and LUIS so that you can easily start building intelligent bots. You’ll then learn how to make the bot interaction more natural by surfacing the bot functionality through a Cortana skill.
item.itunes:summary: This session introduces you to Microsoft Bot Framework and LUIS so that you can easily start building intelligent bots. You’ll then learn how to make the bot interaction more natural by surfacing the bot functionality through a Cortana skill.
item.dc:creator: James Carpinter

item.title: Azure: building applications using Azure Service Fabric and ASP.NET Core
item.description: Join us to learn how you can build microservice applications with .NET Core and Azure Service Fabric.  We will cover key capabilities and concepts that enable developers to build stateless or stateful applications with Service Fabric, show you how to use the reverse proxy to communicate between services, and talk about intelligent gateways for your application access.
item.itunes:summary: Join us to learn how you can build microservice applications with .NET Core and Azure Service Fabric. We will cover key capabilities and concepts that enable developers to build stateless or stateful applications with Service Fabric, show you how to use the reverse proxy to communicate between services, and talk about intelligent gateways for your application access.
item.dc:creator: Vaclav Turecek

item.title: Bring speech to your app by using Custom Speech Service
item.description: This session will show you how Custom Speech Service brings advanced speech capabilities to your apps. The service makes it easy to build custom speech classifiers.
item.itunes:summary: This session will show you how Custom Speech Service brings advanced speech capabilities to your apps. The service makes it easy to build custom speech classifiers.
item.dc:creator: James Carpinter

item.title: Azure: Bring your app to the cloud with serverless Azure Functions
item.description: Learn how to leverage the power of serverless compute and data on Azure in this hands-on training session. You'll see how to migrate an on-premises app to the cloud and refactor API endpoints to take advantage of serverless functions. You'll debug and run functions locally, publish them to the Azure portal, and capture rich telemetry with Application Insights.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to leverage the power of serverless compute and data on Azure in this hands-on training session. You'll see how to migrate an on-premises app to the cloud and refactor API endpoints to take advantage of serverless functions. You'll debug and run functions locally, publish them to the Azure portal, and capture rich telemetry with Application Insights.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Likness

item.title: The Developer Data Scientist – Creating New Analytics Driven Applications Using Azure Databricks and Apache Spark
item.description: This session gives an introduction to machine learning for developers who are new to data science, and it shows how to build end-to-end MLlib Pipelines in Apache Spark. It provides example code to personalize recommendations, score inbound leads, or do natural language processing in Scala and Python. See how to productionize machine learning pipelines to create richer, more useful applications.
item.itunes:summary: This session gives an introduction to machine learning for developers who are new to data science, and it shows how to build end-to-end MLlib Pipelines in Apache Spark. It provides example code to personalize recommendations, score inbound leads, or do natural language processing in Scala and Python. See how to productionize machine learning pipelines to create richer, more useful applications.

item.title: DevOps for any language and any platform
item.description: In this session, learn how you can use Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) to deploy any language that targets any platform. You can deploy from Windows to Linux and mobile to containers.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, learn how you can use Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) to deploy any language that targets any platform. You can deploy from Windows to Linux and mobile to containers.
item.dc:creator: Donovan Brown, Jessica Deen

item.title: DevOps + SQL
item.description: In this session, we will look at the current state of the art and future of SQL Server and SQL Tools in DevOps practice. Using database CICD automation in Visual Studio Team Service as the key scenario, we will walkthrough how to enable SQL Server 2017 in Docker container to boost-up dev and test productivity and look into database development solutions in Visual Studio 2017 supporting both migration and state-based database projects.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, we will look at the current state of the art and future of SQL Server and SQL Tools in DevOps practice. item.dc:creator: Eric Kang

item.title: Xamarin: Future of app development
item.description: Learn how to use your .NET and C# skills to create iOS and Android mobile apps in Visual Studio with Xamarin. We cover the Xamarin platform and how to create native iOS, Android, and Windows apps in C#. See what’s new and next for Xamarin development inside Visual Studio. Live coding adventures throughout the session show you the latest in native cross-platform development.
item.itunes:summary: Learn how to use your .NET and C# skills to create iOS and Android mobile apps in Visual Studio with Xamarin. We cover the Xamarin platform and how to create native iOS, Android, and Windows apps in C#. See what’s new and next for Xamarin development inside Visual Studio. Live coding adventures throughout the session show you the latest in native cross-platform development.
item.dc:creator: James Montemagno

item.title: Leverage data to build intelligent apps
item.description: This technical session uncovers how developers can build personalized applications at global scale with Azure data services. It gives an overview of the Microsoft data platform and explains how to get stared with operational database services like SQL DB, MySQL, PostgreSQL and Azure Cosmos DB. It shows how to build serverless experiences and personalization into your application. And it shows how to innovate with analytics and AI.
item.itunes:summary: This technical session uncovers how developers can build personalized applications at global scale with Azure data services. It gives an overview of the Microsoft data platform and explains how to get stared with operational database services like SQL DB, MySQL, PostgreSQL and Azure Cosmos DB. It shows how to build serverless experiences and personalization into your application. And it shows how to innovate with analytics and AI.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Liu

item.title: CI/CD DevOps Pipeline for mobile apps and services
item.description: Explore the complete mobile DevOps offering from Microsoft. With Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and Visual Studio App Center, you’ll have everything you need to create a complete CI/CD pipeline for your apps. In this session, we demonstrate exactly how to use VSTS and App Center to deploy a mobile solution, including the back-end services and database.
item.itunes:summary: Explore the complete mobile DevOps offering from Microsoft. With Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) and Visual Studio App Center, you’ll have everything you need to create a complete CI/CD pipeline for your apps. In this session, we demonstrate exactly how to use VSTS and App Center to deploy a mobile solution, including the back-end services and database.

item.title: Automate business processes with Microsoft Graph and Azure Functions
item.description: Business processes can be difficult to implement across systems, authentication mechanisms, and data types. With Microsoft Graph, you have one key source to get information about people, organizations, mail, and more in your organization. Azure Functions lets you quickly bind to that data and deploy it in the Azure cloud. This session shows how to quickly build out value tools and processes for your organization.

item.title: Introducing Visual Studio App Center: Build, test, distribute, and monitor apps in the cloud
item.description:
App stores have never been more competitive. We’ll show you how to manage your development lifecycle and start shipping 5-star apps. Learn how to automate the lifecycle of your iOS, Android, Windows, and macOS apps using Visual Studio App Center. Connect your repo and within minutes build in the cloud, test on thousands of real devices, distribute to beta testers and app stores, and monitor real-world usage with crash and analytics data.

(Note: this session was previously called "Ship 5-star iOS, Android, Windows and macOS apps faster" before the 11/15 announcement and has been updated)

item.title: Azure Functions: Build apps faster and scale on demand
item.description: Learn about the benefits that Azure Functions and serverless bring to your dev toolkit. See the serverless application lifecycle from beginning to end: develop, debug, deploy, and monitor. Whether C#, Node, or Java, you can use Azure Functions to publish cloud-scale apps in minutes and without having to worry about infrastructure.

item.title: Building amazing applications with the Fluent Design System
item.description: See how easy it is to use familiar technologies like XAML and C# to create business apps that bring Fluent Design to life on Windows 10 across a range of devices and inputs. We cover the elements of the design system and how to use the latest controls, animations, and effects to captivate your customers and maximize their productivity. We build an app together and share guidelines, tips, and tricks.

item.title: Transform business-critical .NET apps with containers and Azure
item.description: Your business depends on mission-critical applications built on .NET. We’ll show why you’d want to modernize your existing .NET apps with Windows containers and Azure Service Fabric. We’ll show how you can benefit from secure clusters, monitoring and diagnostics, and availability zones. We’ll use demos and examples to show how you can move your applications to cloud quickly and add new microservices with Service Fabric.

item.dc:creator: James Sturtevant

item.title: Engaging with your customers on any platform using the Microsoft Graph, Activity Feed, and Adaptive Cards
item.description: With the power of Microsoft Graph, Activity Feed, and Adaptive Cards, you can enable your applications to transcend platform boundaries and engage with customers anywhere. These same APIs will give you an exciting engagement opportunity in the Windows 10 Timeline feature shipping in the upcoming update of Windows 10.  These APIs work on Windows 10, iOS, Android, and Xamarin—and they’re RESTful.
item.itunes:summary: With the power of Microsoft Graph, Activity Feed, and Adaptive Cards, you can enable your applications to transcend platform boundaries and engage with customers anywhere. These same APIs will give you an exciting engagement opportunity in the Windows 10 Timeline feature shipping in the upcoming update of Windows 10. These APIs work on Windows 10, iOS, Android, and Xamarin—and they’re RESTful.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Fennel, Shawn Henry

item.title: Enable edge intelligence with Azure IoT Edge
item.description: Make hybrid cloud and edge IoT solutions a reality with Azure IoT Edge, a newly released capability that enables cloud workloads to run locally on your Windows- and Linux-based IoT devices. Tune in to learn more about how you can dev/test in the cloud and then deploy to the edge via Docker-compatible containers—all in a seamless development environment.
item.itunes:summary: Make hybrid cloud and edge IoT solutions a reality with Azure IoT Edge, a newly released capability that enables cloud workloads to run locally on your Windows- and Linux-based IoT devices. Tune in to learn more about how you can dev/test in the cloud and then deploy to the edge via Docker-compatible containers—all in a seamless development environment.
item.dc:creator: Arjmand Samuel

item.title: Agile project management with Visual Studio Team Services
item.description: Aaron and Sondra show you how to transform the way you work with Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS). Whether you're a Kanban team hyper focused on WIP and cycle time, or a Scrum team trying to nail every sprint, VSTS has the tools you need to keep your teams moving fast and aligned on what's important.
item.itunes:summary: Aaron and Sondra show you how to transform the way you work with Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS). Whether you're a Kanban team hyper focused on WIP and cycle time, or a Scrum team trying to nail every sprint, VSTS has the tools you need to keep your teams moving fast and aligned on what's important.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Bjork, Sondra Batbold

item.title: Bring AI to the mainstream with updates to Azure Machine Learning
item.description: We take a look at updates to Azure Machine Learning that help you create and deliver powerful AI solutions. We show you how Machine Learning will help you perform data cleaning with AI-assisted data prep, increase the rate of experimentation with agile AI development, deploy models everywhere on any device or service, and monitor and manage your models that are being used in production.
item.itunes:summary: We take a look at updates to Azure Machine Learning that help you create and deliver powerful AI solutions. We show you how Machine Learning will help you perform data cleaning with AI-assisted data prep, increase the rate of experimentation with agile AI development, deploy models everywhere on any device or service, and monitor and manage your models that are being used in production.
item.dc:creator: Sandhya Vankamamidi

item.title: A day in the life of a modern .NET developer
item.description: A series of .NET applications shows how you can use the cloud to streamline .NET development. See how to move existing investments to modern build and deployment pipelines with containers, without changing your application code base. Then learn the new libraries and tools available to integrate .NET Core microservice patterns. Finally, see how to build, debug, deploy, and monitor applications in the cloud.
item.itunes:summary: A series of .NET applications shows how you can use the cloud to streamline .NET development. See how to move existing investments to modern build and deployment pipelines with containers, without changing your application code base. Then learn the new libraries and tools available to integrate .NET Core microservice patterns. Finally, see how to build, debug, deploy, and monitor applications in the cloud.
item.dc:creator: Scott Hunter, Aditi Dugar

item.title: Microsoft Cognitive Services: infusing language and speech capabilities into your apps and bots
item.description: We have learned how to communicate with machines. Isn’t it time machines learn to communicate with us? We discuss how you can add language understanding to your applications through industry examples and interactive conversations. We discuss some of the challenges of unstructured data, and we show how Microsoft Cognitive Services and Azure Search can help you navigate it, understand it, and extract insight from it.

We discuss how you can add language understanding to your applications through industry examples and interactive conversations. We discuss some of the challenges of unstructured data, and we show how Microsoft Cognitive Services and Azure Search can help you navigate it, understand it, and extract insight from it.
item.dc:creator: Luis Cabrera-Cordon, Giampaolo Battaglia

item.title: Tips and Tricks for Visual Studio IDE and editor
item.description: This fast-paced talk demonstrates some of our favorite tips and tricks for Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio for Mac, and Visual Studio 2017. Whether you're interested in quick ways to customize your IDE or editor, making the most of keyboard shortcuts, using new features, or making the most of debugging capabilities, you can make your Visual Studio experience more productive!
item.itunes:summary: This fast-paced talk demonstrates some of our favorite tips and tricks for Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio for Mac, and Visual Studio 2017. Whether you're interested in quick ways to customize your IDE or editor, making the most of keyboard shortcuts, using new features, or making the most of debugging capabilities, you can make your Visual Studio experience more productive!

item.title: Keynote - Journey to the intelligent cloud
item.description:
Scott will share how Microsoft is empowering developers to lead the new digital revolution by creating apps that will have a profound impact on the world.

Additional speakers showcased include:

item.title: Fireside Chat and Live Q&A
item.description: Channel 9 live Q&A interviews with keynote speakers, demoers and surprise guests – moderated by Christina Warren
item.itunes:summary: Channel 9 live Q&A interviews with keynote speakers, demoers and surprise guests – moderated by Christina Warren

item.title: Keynote - Building the intelligent apps of the future
item.description: We asked top Microsoft developers what it might look like to build tomorrow's intelligent applications – they agreed to show us! Join Miguel de Icaza, Scott Hanselman, and others as they demystify the magic of AI and what it can do for your applications.
item.itunes:summary: We asked top Microsoft developers what it might look like to build tomorrow's intelligent applications – they agreed to show us! Join Miguel de Icaza, Scott Hanselman, and others as they demystify the magic of AI and what it can do for your applications.
item.dc:creator: Miguel de Icaza, Scott Hanselman, Seth Juarez

item.title: Developer tools for app innovation
item.description: In this session, Julia Liuson, CVP for Developer Division at Microsoft, takes a detailed look at how Visual Studio, Visual Studio for Mac, Visual Studio Code, and .NET empowers developers to create innovative apps. You'll learn all about the exciting capabilities we have just added to our products and get a sneak peek at what we are working on for the future.
item.itunes:summary: In this session, Julia Liuson, CVP for Developer Division at Microsoft, takes a detailed look at how Visual Studio, Visual Studio for Mac, Visual Studio Code, and .NET empowers developers to create innovative apps. You'll learn all about the exciting capabilities we have just added to our products and get a sneak peek at what we are working on for the future.
item.dc:creator: Julia Liuson

item.title: Build intelligent apps with Microsoft data platform
item.description: Data, AI and Cloud are transforming businesses across industries, while empowering developers to build new, delightful apps for their users. Join this session to learn how to easily integrate data into your applications across hybrid and open source environments, using your choice of languages (like java, node.js, .NET, Python), databases (like SQL, NoSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL) and big data products (like Hadoop). You'll see code in action, get ideas on what you can do for your users, and learn how Microsoft's data and AI innovations can help along the way.

Join this session to learn how to easily integrate data into your applications across hybrid and open source environments, using your choice of languages (like java, node.js, .NET, Python), databases (like SQL, NoSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL) and big data products (like Hadoop). You'll see code in action, get ideas on what you can do for your users, and learn how Microsoft's data and AI innovations can help along the way.
item.dc:creator: Rohan Kumar

item.title: Azure DevOps simplified
item.description: Brian Harry showcases the new and noteworthy additions to Azure, Visual Studio Team Services and Team Foundation Server 2018 that are enabling organizations to further evolve and streamline their DevOps processes and speed of deployment. Brian will demonstrate how easy it is to get started with a Continuous Delivery pipeline to deploy your applications into the cloud and then extend these further as your application and your team grow.

Brian will demonstrate how easy it is to get started with a Continuous Delivery pipeline to deploy your applications into the cloud and then extend these further as your application and your team grow.

item.title: How to get started with Microsoft AI
item.description: Join Joseph Sirosh, Corporate VP of the Cloud AI Platform, as he walks through the Microsoft AI platform and capabilities to allow any developer to infuse intelligence into their applications and target entirely new scenarios enabled by the latest innovations in AI.
item.itunes:summary: Join Joseph Sirosh, Corporate VP of the Cloud AI Platform, as he walks through the Microsoft AI platform and capabilities to allow any developer to infuse intelligence into their applications and target entirely new scenarios enabled by the latest innovations in AI.

item.title: Build and ship apps faster with C# and Visual Studio App Center
item.description:
See Microsoft's vision for the future of developer productivity. Create beautiful, native apps and powerful cloud services with shared C# in Visual Studio. Continuously build, test, distribute, and monitor your apps with Visual Studio App Center.

Learn more & get started: https://www.visualstudio.com/app-center/

Continuously build, test, distribute, and monitor your apps with Visual Studio App Center. Learn more & get started: https://www.visualstudio.com/app-center/
item.dc:creator: Nat Friedman

item.title: Application modernization with Microsoft Azure
item.description:
Learn how Azure helps modernize applications faster with containers and how you can use serverless to add additional functionality while keeping your production codebase 'clean'. We'll also learn how to incorporate DevOps throughout your apps lifecycle, and take advantage of data-driven intelligence.

Resources:

- Smarthotel360-Azure GitHub repo
